total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grids of the examples. In this case, the pattern seems to be a square or rectangle of a certain color (3, 2, 5, 8) with the same color border and the rest of the grid being 0.

Q2: Identify the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples. The transformation seems to be that the border of the square or rectangle moves one step diagonally towards the center.
Q3: Identify the color of the square or rectangle in the input grid of the quiz.
Q4: Apply the transformation identified in Q2 to the square or rectangle identified in Q3 in the input grid of the quiz.

Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grids of the examples. In this case, the pattern seems to be a square or rectangle of a certain color (3, 2, 5, 8) with the same color border and the inside filled with 0s.
Q2: Identify the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples. The transformation seems to be a rotation of the square or rectangle by 45 degrees.
Q3: Identify the color of the square or rectangle in the input grid of the quiz.
Q4: Apply the transformation to the square or rectangle in the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
